p: In the course of TBEV infection in Caco-2 cells strong vacuolization was found, whereas morphological changes such as aggregation and shrinkage of cells or detachment of the monolayer were not observed at 48 h p.i. ( Figure 2). TBEV-induced vacuolization in infected Caco-2 cells was detected by immunofluorescence microscopy using anti-TBEV E monoclonal antibody at 24 h, 48 h, and 72 h p.i. ( Figure 2).
